intro: Antidesma venosum var. thouarsianum, commonly known as the Madagascar antidesma, is a shrub or small tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with prominent venation. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody, spiny capsules containing small seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry forests and coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
